page.title: 07 GREAT BARR HALL
page.content: The most important{historical building in the area is{Great Barr Hall}which is a grade 2 listed building.It was owned for many years by members of the Scott family, who were originally forced to move from Scotland to England by Edward I for opposing him. The most famous member of the family was Sir Joseph Scott, who restored the Hall with his wife's Â£2,000 dowry, in the eighteenth century. In 1795 he asked the country's leading landscape gardener{Humphry Repton}to re-design the grounds. During the next four years, thousands of trees were planted and two large lakes were dug. The Hall is now a shell but its Gothic front and embattled walls are still fine examples of innovative architecture. You can still see the lakes and trees in the existing grounds of{St. {Margaret's Hospital.
